# `abs_plot_module`    ```{eval-rst}.. function:: abs_plot_module.draw_abs_figure    Makes a flux vs velocity graph, that also has the error vs velocity on the same graph. Has text that identifies     what the graph number is, what the spectra name is, the signal to noise ratio, and the redshift value used.        :param kind: spectra_count_abs    :type kind: int or list[int]    :description: Keeping record of how many absorption plots have been found.            :param kind: spectra_index    :type kind: int or list[int]    :description: The index number of the graph you are plotting.            :param kind: velocity    :type kind: array[int] or list[int]    :description: The velocity values to plot on the x-axis.            :param kind: flux_normalized    :type kind: array[int] or list[int]    :description: The flux values that will be plotted on the y-axis.            :param kind: error    :type kind: array[int] or list[int]    :description: The error values to be plotted.            :param kind: savefile_name    :type kind: string    :description: The name that you want the plot to be saved as.            :param kind: spectra_name    :type kind: string    :description: The full name of the spectra.             :param kind: redshift    :type kind: int or list[int] or array[int]    :description: The redshift value used for calculations.            :param kind: snr    :type kind: int or list[int] or array[int]    :description: The signal to noise ratio value.            :param kind: max_peak    :type kind: int or array[int]    :description: The max peak value which is used to scale the y-axis.     :returns: none```
